notes: Local residents launched a barricade outside Dr. Jose Fabella Memorial Hospital in Manila, Metro Manila on 1 June 2016 to stop the pull-out of equipment and demonstrate against its planned closure. Reports indicate that the barricade lasted at least until July 2016. [size=several]

assoc_actor_2: PDP-Laban: Philippine Democratic Party-Power of the Nation
notes: On 1 Jun 2016, a newly elected town councilor under the Partido Demokratiko Pilipino-Lakas ng Bayan (PDP-Laban) was shot dead by unidentified armed men in Brgy. Poblacion, Trento, Agusan del Sur. Two other supporters were hurt.

On 1 Jun 2016, two soldiers were killed and five others wounded from am improvised explosive device (IED) explosion presumably planted by the Maute Group in Brgy. Sandab, Butig, Lanao del Sur. The explosion occurred following the military operations against the Maute in Butig, Lanao del Sur, which started on 26 May 2016.
On 2 Jun 2016, the military announced seizure of an training camp for the Maute by the 51st Infantry Battalion who were conducting clearing operations in Brgy. Poctan, Butig, Lanao del Sur.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. Zone 15, Talisay City, Negros Occidental around 2-5 Jun 2016 with a sign 'I am a member of Akyat Bahay, a thief, an addict. Don't follow my example because you will be killed next'.
A drug suspect and lawyer was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men at Brgy. Looc, Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental on 3 Jun 2016.

Defusal: On 3 Jun 2016, an improvised explosive device (IED) was defused by Iligan city police in Brgy. Gadongan, Marawi City, Lanao del Sur. The bomb was reportedly intended for the military who are in the area, following military operations against the Maute in Butig, Lanao del Sur, which started on 26 May 2016.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Calatrava, Negros Occidental around 2-5 Jun 2016.

Arrests: Assumed on 4 Jun 2016, two high profile leaders of the New People's Army (NPA) Guerilla Front Committee 4A Sparu unit and two others were captured during a raid by joint military and police forces in Butuan City, Agusan del Norte. (No shootout reported.)

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. San Vicente, Leganes, Iloilo on 4 Jun 2016. He is being charged for a murder case and had been previously charged with several cases of robbery.
A drug suspect was killed with an ice pick in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Quezon City, Metro Manila on June 2016. His body was found on 4 June 2016.

A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. San Jose, Villa Arevalo District, Iloilo City, Iliolo on 4 Jun 2016. He had been recently released from detention for an illegal drugs or firearms case.

On 5 Jun 2016, New People's Army (NPA) members killed a police officer while wounding two other police officers in an NPA ambush followed by a 10-minute firefight which happened in Sitio Tangad, Brgy. Gangao, Baleno, Masbate.
Five drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Brgy. Cawayan, Inabanga, Bohol, on 5 Jun 2016. Three others were arrested.
On 5 Jun 2016, suspected Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) members killed two soldiers of the 64th Infantry Battalion in an ambush in Brgy. Tumahubong, Sumisip, Basilan.

On 5 Jun 2016, a firefight occurred between New People's Army-South Central Bukidnon Sub-regional Command members and the Magahat-Alamara paramilitary group in Brgy. Indalasa, Malaybalay City, Bukidnon, killing four people, including a 7-year old civilian.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Davao City, Davao del Sur around 6 Jun 2016.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Regional Intelligence Unit
notes: Arrests: On 6 Jun 2016, a leader of the New People's Army (NPA) Sangay sa Partido Platoon 21C, Guerilla Front Committee 21 was captured during a raid by a joint team of the Regional Intelligence Division Tracker Team and the Regional Public Safety Battalion in Brgy. Ladgaron, Claver, Surigao del Norte.

On 7 Jun 2016, a roadside bomb set off by unidentified assailants in Brgy. Meta, Datu Unsay, Maguindanao, injured one soldier of the 34th Infantry Battalion (IB). BIFF is suspected to have planted the bomb but denied any links to the attack.
On 7 Jun 2016, unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men shot dead a police officer and the wife of a Maguindanao vice mayor in Tacurong City, Sultan Kudarat.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Tagbilaran City, Bohol on 7 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Brgy. Tagapo, Sta. Rosa City, Laguna on 8 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Brgy. Buenavista, Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur on 9 Jun 2016.

Sectoral groups, health workers and community members intensified their demonstration and barricade at the Dr. Jose Fabella Memorial Hospital, Manila, Metro Manila on 9 June 2016, a day foreseen for the closure of the hospital. [size=several]
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Miguel town area, Bulacan on 9 Jun 2016.
Drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Brgy. Tigpalas, San Miguel, Bulacan on 9 Jun 2016.

Student activists stormed the main office of the Commission on Higher Education (Ched) in Quezon City, Metro Manila on 10 June 2016 to demonstrate the approval of tuition and other fees hikes in schools and universities. [size=several]

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Philippines); Fishermen (Philippines); Farmers (Philippines); ALU: Associated Labor Unions
notes: On 10 Jun 2016, around 200 contractual workers of Citinickel Mines and Development Corp. (CMDC) led by Associated Labor Unions (ALU), staged a protest at the mine site in Brgy. Bato-Bato, Narra, Palawan to oppose labor contracting and union busting. Local indigenous people (from KAMPU ng Tagbanua Narra Palawan Inc.), fishermen and farmers, also joined them to denounce Citinickel's violations of a Memorandum of Agreement with the indigenous people and other environmental laws.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Talavera, Nueva Ecija on 10 Jun 2016. Her brother-in-law was also shot dead.
On 11 Jun 2016, suspected New People's Army (NPA) members killed two soldiers in Brgy. Cabiguan, Pilar, Sorsogon.

Several youth organizations staged a protest in front of the US Embassy in Manila, Metro Manila on 12 June 2016 (Philippine Independence Day) against inter-country treaties such as the Enhanced Defense Cooperation Agreement (EDCA). [size=several]

On 12 Jun 2016, Independence Day, 16 members of the Kalayaan Atin Ito (Freedom This is Ours) group including an American volunteer from Sea Access by International Law (SAIL) were blocked and sprayed with water by Chinese Coast Guard ships as they were trying to sail to the Scarborough shoal. The group is protesting China's occupation in the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea) Shoal.

High school and college students from around Metro Manila started the new school year on 13 June 2016 with a protest at the Department of Education (DepEd) in Pasig City, Metro Manila against the K to 12 education program's implementation.

assoc_actor_1: KABATAAN: Kabataan Partylist; LFS: League of Filipino Students
notes: On 13 Jun 2016, youth members of the League of Filipino Students (LFS) and Kabataan partylist held a protest in front of the Department of Education Central Office in Meralco Ave., Pasig City, Metro Manila to oppose the implementation of the K to 12 Program.

On 13 Jun 2016, members of the Alliance of Concerned Teachers (ACT) held a protest in Recto Avenue, Manila, Metro Manila to oppose the implementation of the K to 12 Program of the Department of Education.

On 13 Jun 2016, the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) executed a Canadian captive after the deadline for his ransom passed in Brgy. Lower Sinumaan, Talipao, Sulu. The victim was kidnapped last 21 Sept 2015 on Samal island, Davao, along with 3 others.

source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Thai News Service
notes: On 13 Jun 2016, a protest was held by the members of the National Alliance School Service Association of the Philippines (Nassap) in Quezon City, Metro Manila to oppose the phase out of vehicle units which are at least 15 years old.
On 13 Jun 2016, an unidentified assailants threw a grenade towards a military truck in Jolo area, Sulu. Seven soldiers were wounded.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Brgy. Sinalhan, Sta. Rosa City, Laguna on 14 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. Poblacion, Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental on 14 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at San Antonio, Nueva Ecija around 14 Jun 2016.
A murder suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. Dawis, Pototan, Iloilo on 14 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Brgy. Sta. Rita, Cabiao, Nueva Ecija on 14 Jun 2016. His 20-year old live in partner was also wounded.

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid at Brgy. MS Garcia, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija around Jun 2016 (report as of 5 Jul 2016 only mentioned they were killed in earlier police operations; assumed event date is Jun 2016 with TP 3).

source: ProtectDefenders.eu; Front Line Defenders; Sunstar (Philippines); News Desk (Philippines)
notes: On 15 Jun 2016, in Bukidnon province, a farmer and Lumad tribal chieftain of Sitio Kisapwac, Barangay Digongan, Kitaotao, Bukidnon was killed by a suspected military officer of the 68th Infantry Battalion according human rights group Karapatan (coded the capital of Bukidnon province as location with GP 2).

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Leonardo town area, Nueva Ecija around Jun 2016 (report as of 5 Jul 2016 only mentioned they were killed in earlier police operations; assumed event date is Jun 2016 with TP 3).
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Isulan town area, Sultan Kudarat on 15 Jun 2016.

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Jaen town area, Nueva Ecija around Jun 2016 (report as of 5 Jul 2016 only mentioned they were killed in earlier police operations; assumed event date is Jun 2016 with TP 3).
Local residents launched a barricade in Sitio Camgat, Didipio, Kasibu, Nueva Vizcaya on 15 June 2016 to stop the mining operations of OceanaGold Philippines Inc. (OGPI).
On 15 Jun 2016, New People's Army members attacked policemen along the national highway in Brgy. Casabangan, Pio V. Corpuz, Masbate, leaving one policeman wounded.

A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in San Isidro town area, Nueva Ecija around Jun 2016 (report as of 5 Jul 2016 only mentioned they were killed in earlier police operations; assumed event date is Jun 2016 with TP 3).

On 16 Jun 2016, members of the People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals (PETA) Asia activists held a 5-minute protest in front of a Hermes store in Makati City, Metro Manila to oppose French high fashion luxury goods manufacturer, Hermes, which allegedly uses ostrich leather for their bags and sofas.
A drug suspect was stabbed dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men. His body was found in Brgy. Aduas Centro, Cabanatuan City, Nueva Ecija on 16 Jun 2016.
Three drug suspects were killed during a police chase 7 kilometers away from San Jose City, Nueva Ecija on 16 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Luisiana town area, Laguna on 16 Jun 2016.

assoc_actor_1: KMU: Kilusang Mayo Uno; Labour Group (Philippines)
notes: The labour centre Kilusang Mayo Uno (KMU) staged a protest at the Japanese Embassy in Pasay City, Metro Manila on 16 June 2016 on behalf of the workers of a Japanese-owned fruit-exporting company (Nakashin Davao International Inc.) demanding full benefits and an end to contractualisation.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Sitio Daang Bakal, Brgy. San Juan, San Miguel, Bulacan on 16 Jun 2016.
A drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Brgy. Leuteboro, Socorro, Oriental Mindoro on 16 Jun 2016.
Local residents staged a barricade in Sitio Camgat, Didipio, Kasibu, Nueva Vizcaya on 16 June 2016 to stop the mining operations of Oceana Gold Philippines Inc. (OGPI).
Local residents staged a barricade in Sitio Camgat, Didipio, Kasibu, Nueva Vizcaya on 17 June 2016 to stop the mining operations of OceanaGold Philippines Inc. (OGPI).

On 17 Jun 2016, a 20-minute firefight occurred between nine New People's Army (NPA) From 73 members and the military in Sitio Lamtapok, Brgy. Ned, Lake Sebu, South Cotabato. Two NPAs were killed due to the incident.

Movement of forces: Assumed on 17 Jun 2016, some 5,000 soldiers have been deployed to Sulu province to strengthen military operations in the area as the Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) continues threats to kill their captives if their demands are not met. The ASG already decapitated two Canadian civilians after the deadline of their ransom has passed.
A drug suspect was shot wounded in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental on 17 Jun 2016.
Two drug suspects, including a most wanted drug lord in Cebu, were killed during a police raid in Las Pinas City, Metro Manila on 17 Jun 2016.
On 17 Jun 2016, an unidentified armed man set off an M-79 launcher which exploded in a cornfield which caused panic among farmers working nearby in Brgy. Kayuko, Pandag, Maguindanao.

Local residents staged a barricade in Sitio Camgat, Didipio, Kasibu, Nueva Vizcaya on 18 June 2016 to stop the mining operations of OceanaGold Philippines Inc. (OGPI). The mining company withdrew its drilling equipment on this day as a result of the demonstration.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Regional Intelligence Unit
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Anti-Illegal Drugs Special Operations Task Force
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid conducted by joint provincial police's intelligence branch and Anti-Illegal Drugs Special Operations Task Group at Brgy. Balibago, Calatagan, Batangas on 19 Jun 2016.

On 19 Jun 2016, unidentified motorcycle-riding armed men shot dead an assistant chief of staff for personnel of the Army's First Infantry 'Tabak' Division outside the victim's house in Aurora Village, Brgy. Guiwan, Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur.
On 20 Jun 2016, unidentified armed men threw a grenade at a police station inside a government complex in Maasim town area, Sarangani, which injured six police officers and two civilians.
On 20 June 2016, a teacher was abducted by Abu Sayyaf militants in Kalingalan Caluang, Sulu, and was later forced to marry one of her abductors.

On 20 Jun 2016, unidentified armed men hijacked a tugboat sailing Sulu sea, Philippines en route to Samarinda, East Kalimantan, Indonesia and abducted seven Indonesian sailors. Six other sailors were left unharmed.

On 21 Jun 2016, an hour-long firefight occurred between around 200 Abu Sayyaf Group (ASG) members and the 32nd Infantry Battalion in Sitio Bud Duwa Bayho, Brgy. Pansul, Patikul, Sulu. Three ASG members were killed while 26 were wounded, 16 of whom were soldiers.

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 21 Jun 2016, in Paquibato District, Davao City, Davao del Sur, New People's Army (NPA) ambushed two militiamen who were unarmed and onboard a motorcycle. One militiaman was killed and another wounded.

On 21 Jun 2016, a protest led by Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) was held in Mendiola, Manila, Metro Manila to protest failures of the government led by President Benigno Aquino III, among them, the substandard state of the Metro Rail Transit, delays in Yolanda rehabilitation, and the Mamasapano massacre.
Three drug suspects were shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Brgy. Poblacion, Kidapawan City, Cotabato, on 21 Jun 2016.

actor1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Criminal Investigation and Detection Group
assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Highway Patrol Group
notes: Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid conducted by joint operatives of the Criminal Investigation and Detective Group (CIDG), Highway Patrol Group, and the City Hall Detachment at Quezon City, Metro Manila on 21 Jun 2016.

assoc_actor_1: Fishermen (Philippines); PPVR: People Power Volunteers for Reform
notes: On 22 Jun 2016, around 100 fishermen staged a protest organized by the People Power Volunteers for Reform (PPVR), National Youth Movement for the West Philippines Sea, among others, in Masinloc, Zambales, to oppose China's occupation in the West Philippine Sea (South China Sea) Panatag Shoal.

On 22 Jun 2016, a roadside bomb planted by the Bangsamoro Islamic Freedom Fighters (BIFF) exploded near Dabpil Sampulna High School, Brgy. Ulandang, Midsayap, North Cotabato, injuring two soldiers and a high school student.
Two drug suspects were killed during a police raid in Malasiqui town area, Pangasinan on 23 Jun 2016.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: Assumed on 23 Jun 2016, alleged New People's Army (NPA) members killed a member of the Civilian Armed Forces Geographical Unit (CAFGU) in Sitio Ubo-ub, Brgy. Calaban, Tinoc, Ifugao.

Three drug suspects were killed during a police raid at Arboretum Forest, Brgy. UP campus, Quezon City, Metro Manila on 24 Jun 2016. Five other suspects who are alleged members of the Joselito Gonzales drug group escaped.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2010-2016)
notes: A drug suspect who is also a village chief was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified armed men at Tuguegarao City, Cagayan on 24 Jun 2016. The gunman left a piece of paper which says, 'Pusher ako, huwag tularan' (I am a pusher, do not follow in my footsteps). Two (2) others were hurt.

On 26 Jun 2016, an event attended by members of Bantayog, Martial Law Chronicles, University of the Philippines Samasa alumni, Claimants 1081, Nameless Heroes and Martyrs, Akbayan Youth, Dakila and Filipino Freethinkers, placed stones with names of martial law victims in a plot where the late dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. will be buried to protest President Rodrigo Duterte's decision to bury Marcos at the Libingan ng mga Bayani, Taguig City.
On 27 Jun 2016, unidentified armed men threw a grenade at the house of a village chief in Brgy. Dona Ramona in Isabela City, Basilan, injuring two children.

On 27 Jun 2016, a clash occurred between the police and rioting residents of a private property which is to be demolished after a Supreme Court decision ruling in favor of a private individual over the ownership of an 8,000-sqm property in Brgy. 8, Caloocan City, Metro Manila. Seven were hurt, six of whom were policemen.

Arrests: On 29 Jun 2016, the military arrested a suspected leader of the New People's Army (NPA) Pulang Bagani Company (PBC) 3 of the Southern Mindanao Regional Committee in Brgy. Bongabong, Panutukan, Davao de Oro.
On 29 Jun 2016, two roadside bombings and one detonation occurred in Zamboanga City, Zamboanga del Sur. One person was hrut in the bombings. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

assoc_actor_2: Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2010-2016)
notes: On 29 Jun 2016, unidentified armed men shot dead a retired police officer in his residence in Novaliches, Quezon City, Metro Manila.
